nodes.bodyText: Did you verify we can't get the device names from AWSMobileClient?
Will verify with jithin or someone else before I push this!

https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-ios/blob/main/AmplifyPlugins/Auth/AWSCognitoAuthPlugin/Support/Utils/Device%2BExtension.swift
Swift appears to be ignoring name when creating a device also.
This is the pattern that I usually follow, but I was trying to match the other methods in this class.

Naming: this should be forgetCurrentDevice(), to clearly distinguish it from forgetDevice(AuthDevice specificDevice). I would not compromise the naming just to match iOS. We should ask the iOS team to update their name if they're not using this, too.

They have it set up such that AuthDevice parameter is nullable, and if none is passed, the method exhibits above behavior. It was in my discretion to overload the method and make AuthDevice a @NonNull parameter to go along with Android specific pattern. I believe it is okay to rename this method as you suggest.
Since we have a forceDevice(AuthDevice specificDevice), I suggest that we call this rememberCurrentDevice(). (Same for Rx bindings, of course, as well.)
